articles.title: Sydney Opera House piano tuner Terry Harper retires after 40 years
articles.description: When Terry Harper first set foot inside the Sydney Opera House it was an "empty cavern". He would spend a lifetime inside its venues making sure every piano note was perfect.
articles.content:
Terry Harper can barely play a chord, but he has made thousands of songs sound perfect.
One of the world's great pianists describes Mr Harper as the doctor who heals his throat so he can sing.
For 40 years, the piano tuner has been getting under the ... [5872 chars]

articles.title: Sydney team develop AI model to identify thoughts from brainwaves
articles.description: Sydney researchers have developed an AI model that can decipher words and sentences from brainwaves detected by a wearable cap. It opens up a new frontier to help patients with cognition, but could also revolutionise how humans interact with computers.
articles.content:
What if you could operate your phone just by thinking about it?
And imagine your phone automatically enhancing your concentration and memory? Or even being used to read someone else's mind?
It sounds like science fiction, but this technology, called ... [7470 chars]
